name: Resource Rows
subtitle: World's first residential project from demolished building materials - 463 tonnes diverted from landfill
data_source: NREP LCA/LCC Report + Miljøstyrelsen Product Documentation

executive_summary.headline: 463 tonnes of demolition waste transformed into 92 townhouses - proving industrial upcycling commercially viable
key_achievements: 463 tonnes construction waste upcycled instead of landfilled
29% CO2 reduction over 50-year lifecycle vs benchmark
2,914 m² UP Mur brick modules - 1×1m sections cut intact from demolition
7 tonnes Douglas fir from Dinesen production offcuts
Metro railway sleepers as shou-sugi-ban treated terraces
Concrete beams from Vox factory as pedestrian bridge
Built at same price per m² as conventional construction
Created 18 jobs (0.5 FTE years) through material processing
executive_summary.why_strong: Resource Rows was the proof-of-concept that scaled Upcycle House methodology to commercial multi-family housing. The UP Mur innovation (cutting intact brick sections) solved the brick reuse quality problem. Third-party LCA/LCC verification provides rare cost transparency.
executive_summary.why_tier: Completeness score 88/100 (Grade A). Exceptional documentation with verified LCA/LCC, detailed material quantities, and published Miljøstyrelsen product documentation.

overview.innovation: UP Mur, UP Vinduer, UP Beton methodology

materials.description: 2,914 m² brick facade modules - 1×1m sections cut intact from demolished buildings and cast into concrete backing
materials.processing: Brick sections cut with diamond wire, cast into prefab concrete backing panels

materials.description: Reused windows with 50% reclaimed double-glazed glass from energy renovations
Douglas fir offcuts from Dinesen flooring production + Metro railway sleepers
materials.processing: Metro sleepers heat-treated with shou-sugi-ban method; Dinesen offcuts planed and finished

materials.description: Concrete beams from demolished Vox factory reused as pedestrian bridge across courtyard

waste_diverted.description: Building materials upcycled instead of landfilled

cost_comparison.result: Same price per m² as conventional
cost_comparison.innovation: Higher design cost offset by lower material cost

key_insights: UP Mur methodology solved brick reuse quality problem
10% reuse by weight achieved 29% CO2 reduction
Same price achievable with careful design/material trade-offs
innovations: Diamond wire cutting of intact brick sections
Concrete backing panels for structural integrity
Shou-sugi-ban treatment for railway sleeper durability
challenges: Coordinating multiple demolition sites for sourcing
Certifying reused materials to building codes
Quality control across heterogeneous material streams

primary_reports.title: NREP LCA/LCC Report - Upcycle Studios & Resource Rows

narrative.driver: Prove industrial-scale upcycling could work commercially - creating replicable methodology (UP Mur, UP Vinduer, UP Beton) for subsequent projects.
narrative.approach: UP Mur breakthrough - cutting 1×1m brick sections intact preserves visual character while concrete backing provides structural integrity. Coordinated multiple demolition sites for sourcing.
narrative.significance: First residential project built from demolished building materials. 10% reuse by weight achieved 29% CO2 reduction at same price as conventional.
narrative.legacy: UP methodology scaled to UN17 Village and other Lendager projects. Third-party LCA/LCC provides rare cost transparency for circular construction.
